paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Meliboeus adlbaueri
Niehuis 1989 b
: 121
; Kubáň 2006 : 412 ;
Bellamy 2008 c
: 1838
. [subgenus
Meliboeoides
].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Immatures:
Alexeev 1988
: 4 .

Note. Records for Poucht-E-Kouh and Chaldée persane in
Théry ( 1925 )
and western provinces may refer to
M . adlbaueri Niehuis
(see above).

Distribution within Iran .
Sistan & Baluchestan (
Kubáň et al . 2014
).
Distribution outside Iran .
Oman , Pakistan , UAE , Yemen (
Kubáň et al . 2014
).

synonym: proximus
Obenberger 1916
: 269 ; Kubáň 2006 : 49 (synonym of
morawitzi
). synonym: turkestanicus
Obenberger 1924 c
: 33 ; Kubáň 2006 : 49 (synonym of
morawitzi
). misidentification:
subulatus Auct.
(not Morawitz, 1861 )
Bílý 1999
: 31, 2003 : 64 . [subgenus
Meliboeus
].

Immatures:
Bílý 1999
: 31 (as
subulatus Morawitz
).

Biology/Bionomy:
Bílý 2003
: 64 (as
subulatus
).

Distribution within Iran .
Tehran (
Borumand 2002
).

Note. Probably misidentification with
M. caucasicus Abeille
de Perrin 1896 ,
M. reitteri (
Semenov, 1890
)
or
M. subulatus (Morawitz, 1861 )
.

Distribution within Iran .
Fars , Hamadan, Isfahan, Kermanshahan, Khorasan, Kuhgiloyeh & Boyerahmad, Lorestan, Qazvin, Tehran (
Niehuis 2014 c
).

Distribution outside Iran .
Cyprus , Greece , Iraq , Israel , Jordan , Lebanon , Syria , Turkey (
Niehuis 2014 c
).

Immatures:

: 6 .

Note. Records for Armenia , Azerbaijan and Turkey in
Bellamy ( 2008 c)
most probably refer to
M. caucasicus Abeille
de Perrin 1896 which may occur in North-western provinces of Iran .

: 4 .

Distribution within Iran .

Niehuis 2014 b
).

Distribution outside Iran .
None recorded.

).

).
